revised_title: Investigating the Growth and Expansion of Fairy-Rings in Pastures
tldr: The author examines the growth and expansion of fairy-rings in pastures, observing that they are caused by the growth of specific fungi. The fungi absorb all nutrients from the soil beneath the ring, causing the surrounding grass to die. Over time, the ring expands as the fungi consume nutrients and the grass regrows. The author also notes that different species of fungi require the same nutrients, which can cause interference between adjacent rings.
